intro: Anaphalis aureopunctata, commonly known as the golden dot mouse-eared cress, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers with orange-pink markings. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky areas. Anaphalis aureopunctata is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
